sections.label: Collection
sections.heading: Things that matter
sections.subheading: Tools, ideas, people, and places that shape how I work and think. A curated cabinet of curiosities.

items.title: Claude by Anthropic
items.description: An AI assistant that feels like a thoughtful collaborator rather than a tool. Changed how I think about building with AI.

items.title: Cursor Editor
items.description: A code editor built around AI assistance. Makes pair programming with AI feel natural.

items.title: Bauhaus Dessau
items.description: The legendary design school that shaped modern design. Form follows function, grid systems, and geometric clarity.

items.title: Grid Systems in Design
items.description: The invisible structure that makes visual information clear and accessible. Order from chaos.

items.title: Functional Design
items.description: Design that serves its purpose without unnecessary ornament. The idea that beauty emerges from utility.

items.title: Prompt Engineering
items.description: The art of crafting instructions for AI systems. A new form of writing that's part specification, part conversation.

items.title: Benjamin Franklin
items.description: Printer, inventor, diplomat, founder. The original builder who showed that curiosity and experimentation could change the world.

items.title: Paul Revere
items.description: Silversmith, engraver, messenger. A craftsman who became a revolutionary, showing how practical skills can serve bigger purposes.

items.title: Startup Founders
items.description: Modern builders who start with nothing but an idea and determination. The spiritual descendants of the founding fathers.

items.title: Lexington Green
items.description: Where the American Revolution began. A small town common that became the birthplace of a nation.

items.title: The Founding Era
items.description: The period when ordinary people decided to build something new. A time when founders were literally founding a nation.

items.title: Craft With Anna
items.description: A website that inspired this collection format. Personal and curated, like a cabinet of curiosities.
